com.xatkit.core.platform.io

Class RuntimeIntentProvider<T extends RuntimePlatform>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xatkit.core.platform.io.RuntimeEventProvider<T>
      • com.xatkit.core.platform.io.RuntimeIntentProvider<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the concrete RuntimePlatform subclass type containing the provider
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChatIntentProvider

    public abstract class RuntimeIntentProvider<T extends RuntimePlatform>
extends RuntimeEventProvider<T>
    A specialised RuntimeEventProvider that extracts RecognizedIntent from textual user inputs.

    This class wraps a IntentRecognitionProvider instance that is used to extract RecognizedIntents from textual user inputs. Note that the IntentRecognitionProvider instance is not directly accessible by subclasses to avoid uncontrolled accesses such as intent creation, removal, and context manipulation. Subclasses should use getRecognizedIntent(String, XatkitSession) to retrieve RecognizedIntents from textual user inputs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuntimeIntentProvider

        public RuntimeIntentProvider(T runtimePlatform)
        Constructs a new RuntimeIntentProvider from the provided xatkitCore.

        This constructor sets the internal IntentRecognitionProvider instance that is used to parse user input and retrieve RecognizedIntents.

        Note: this constructor should be used by RuntimeIntentProviders that do not require additional parameters to be initialized. In that case see RuntimeIntentProvider(RuntimePlatform, Configuration).

        Parameters:
        runtimePlatform - the RuntimePlatform containing this RuntimeIntentProvider
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided runtimePlatform is null

      • RuntimeIntentProvider

        public RuntimeIntentProvider(T runtimePlatform,
                             Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new RuntimeIntentProvider with the provided runtimePlatform and configuration.

        This constructor sets the internal IntentRecognitionProvider instance that is used to parse user input and retrieve RecognizedIntents.

        Note: this constructor will be called by xatkit internal engine when initializing the XatkitCore component. Subclasses implementing this constructor typically need additional parameters to be initialized, that can be provided in the configuration.

        Parameters:
        runtimePlatform - the RuntimePlatform containing this RuntimeIntentProvider
        configuration - the Configuration used to initialize the RuntimeIntentProvider
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided runtimePlatform is null

    • Method Detail

      • getRecognizedIntent

        public final RecognizedIntent getRecognizedIntent(String input,
                                                  XatkitSession session)
        Returns the RecognizedIntent from the provided user input and session.

        This method wraps the access to the underlying IntentRecognitionProvider, and avoid uncontrolled accesses to the IntentRecognitionProvider from RuntimeIntentProviders (such as intent creation, removal, and context manipulation).

        Note: this method decrements the lifespan counts of the variables in the current context (context lifespan are used to represent the number of user interaction to handled before deleting the variable). Client classes must call this method before setting any context variable otherwise there lifespan counts may be inconsistent from their expected values (e.g. context variables with a lifespan count of 1 will be immediately removed by the RuntimeContexts.decrementLifespanCounts() call).

        Parameters:
        input - the textual user input to extract the RecognizedIntent from
        session - the XatkitSession wrapping the underlying IntentRecognitionProvider's session
        Returns:
        the RecognizedIntent computed by the IntentRecognitionProvider
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided text or session is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided text is empty
        IntentRecognitionProviderException - if the IntentRecognitionProvider is shutdown or if an exception is thrown by the underlying intent recognition engine
